member.name: T:Sudoku.Compatibility.SudokuExplainer.SudokuExplainerDifficultyRatingAttribute

member.summary: Initializes a via the specified difficulty rating value.
member.param: The difficulty rating value. Assign if you don't know the real value.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Compatibility.SudokuExplainer.SudokuExplainerDifficultyRatingAttribute.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a via the specified difficulty rating values as a range.
member.param: The minimum difficulty rating value of the range that the specified technique can be reached. Assign if you don't know the real value.
The maximum difficulty rating value of the range that the specified technique can be reached. Assign if you don't know the real value.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Compatibility.SudokuExplainer.SudokuExplainerDifficultyRatingAttribute.IsAdvancedDefined
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified technique is defined by advanced version of Sudoku Explainer, which is not original program, or other implementations compatible with original Sudoku Explainer's rating system.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Compatibility.SudokuExplainer.SudokuExplainerDifficultyRatingAttribute.IsRange
member.summary: Indicates whether the value is not accurate one to measure the technique's difficulty. If the value is , the difficulty rating is the minimum value (in other words, threshold) of the difficulty corresponding to specified technique.

summary.para: Indicates the maximum possible difficulty rating value that a technique can be reached.
The value is by default, but if the property is set to , this value will not be .

target.name: method
target.summary: Deconstruct the current instance into multiple values, which means you can use the value-tuple syntax to define your own deconstruction logic.
